sentences.english: He told us some interesting things about the western world.
sentences.chinese: 他還告訴過我們西方國家的一些趣聞軼事。

sentences.english: When I was reading the newspaper I came across a very interesting article on swimming.
sentences.chinese: 在瀏覽報紙時，我偶然讀到了一篇關天游泳的趣聞。

sentences.english: It is one of the most famous anecdotes in the history of science.
sentences.chinese: 這是這科史上最著名的趣聞之一。
不過我會給大家講一則趣聞軼事。

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing sidelights on his family background.
sentences.chinese: 書中有很多關於他家庭背景的趣聞。

sentences.english: He bagged anecdotes for a dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她爲編一部詞典蒐集軼事趣聞。

sentences.english: She talked about interesting stories from her workpoint in the production team.
sentences.chinese: 她講起了以前生產隊記工分的趣聞。

sentences.english: It is asking business travellers to share anecdotes of using video-conferencing.
sentences.chinese: 它是向商務旅客建議使用視頻分享商務會議的趣聞。

sentences.english: The papers are full of stories about the royals.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上盡是些關於王室成員趣聞逸事的報道。

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
